docs.text: NAISS Introduction training week ¶ The pages contain information about the NAISS introduction training week that will be given by NAISS in early 2026. The training is open for all current and prospective users of NAISS, from Swedish academia. The training is divided into modules, which will each cover 3 or 6 hours: DAY 1 ¶ Linux Command Line 101 (3 hours) Connecting and File transfers (3 hours) DAY 2 ¶ Selecting software modules (2-3 hours) Running jobs on clusters (3 hours) DAY 3 ¶ Linux Command Line 201 (6 hours) DAY 4 ¶ AI/ML on NAISS systems (3 hours) DAY 5 ¶ Handling sensitive data at NAISS (6 hours) Registration ¶ You can find the registration here:
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Day 1 ¶ Date : Time : 9:00 - 12:00 and 13:00 - 16:00 Linux Command Line 101 ¶ Time : 9:00 - 12:00 This NAISS course is an introduction to Linux, which is what is used on most Swedish HPC centers and indeed on the vast majority of HPC clusters worldwide. It aims to give a brief, but comprehensive introduction to the Linux operating system. It is meant for beginners to the Linux operating system. Prerequisites ¶ You need access to a Linux system. You can use your own computer or any other computer (including computing access at computing centers) you have access to and that runs Linux. Topics ¶ What is Linux and why should I use it? You will learn about the command line interface (CLI) navigating and modifying the file tree ls mkdir cd mv editors on the Linux system pipes, sorting, filters redirection pipes etc. patterns scripting some handy hints and tricks This course will consist of lectures and type-alongs, as well as a few exercises where you get to try out what you have just learned. Note Link to the course material: Linux Command Line 101 . Connecting and File transfers ¶ Time : 13:00 - 16:00 This course will teach you how to login to and transfer files between NAISS HPC clusters. Prerequisites ¶ Prerequisite 1/5: (Windows users only) Have MobaXterm installed Prerequisite 2/5: (Mac and Linux users only) Have rsync installed Prerequisite 3/5: Have FileZilla installed. (if you cannot install, see the FAQ ‘What if I cannot install FileZilla?’) Prerequisite 4/5: Be able to find the course’s Zoom room’s URL on your HPC cluster Prerequisite 5/5: have a good Zoom setup More here: prerequisites . Topics ¶ Login with terminal File transfer using scp File transfer using FileZilla File transfer using rsync Cluster to cluster File transfer using sftp Note Link to the course material: Connecting and file transfers .
docs.title: Day 1
